result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew L Jemison

records.addlTxt: State's Response To Defendant's Motion To Suppress, filed.

Defendant Andrew L Jemison appeared by video.  Attorney Joel Alan Mogren Aty appeared by video for Andrew L Jemison.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense is requesting a Miranda Motion hearing and final pretrial and jury trial.  Case is adjourned to 11-23-22 at 9:00 am for a Mirada Motion Hearing and Final Pretrial and 12-14-22 at 8:30 am for jury trial.
Defense is to file motion by 10-28-22 and State is to reply by 11-11-22.
Motion hearing scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for December 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Andrew L Jemison appeared by video.  Attorney Joel Alan Mogren Aty appeared by video for Andrew L Jemison.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense has discovery and is need of an offer and requesting a status conference hearing date.  Case is adjourned to 10-12-22 at 8:30 am for status conference by zoom.
This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616
Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Andrew L Jemison appeared by video.  Attorney Joel Alan Mogren Aty appeared by video for Andrew L Jemison.  Prosecuting attorney Michelle A. Grasso appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Calendar Call held.  Defendant appearing by zoom, Court vacates previously stayed bench warrant.  Defense counsel needs discovery and offer and requests adjourned status conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.
Status conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Attorney Joel Alan Mogren in court.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Matter scheduled for Pretrial Conference.  Defense counsel is newly appointed and unsure of defendant's present location.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.  Calendar call scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Court ordered no contact with EMH (3/10/1987)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Andrew L Jemison in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Andrew L Jemison in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Andrew L Jemison appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing will be streamed live on DAcast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
